chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
u: nat
l: nat
g: nat
q: nat
p: nat

Goal:
p = u * g -> is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm p (q + p) (l + u * p)

Premises:
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => r div p /\ r div q /\ (forall k : nat, k div p -> k div q -> k div r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
is_lcm = fun p q r : nat => p div r /\ q div r /\ (forall k : nat, p div k -> q div k -> r div k) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_lcm (_ _ _)%nat_scope
is_lcm_minus : forall p q g l u : nat, p <= q -> p = u * g -> is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm p (q - p) (l - u * p)
is_lcm_modulus : forall k p q g l u : nat, k * p <= q -> p = u * g -> is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm p (q - k * p) (l - k * u * p)
is_gcd_mult_lcm : forall p q g l : nat, g <> 0 -> is_gcd p q g -> g * l = p * q -> is_lcm p q l
is_gcd_lcm_mult : forall p q g l : nat, is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> p * q = g * l
is_lcm_mult : forall p q l k : nat, is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm (k * p) (k * q) (k * l)
is_gcd_rel_prime : forall p q g : nat, is_gcd p q g -> exists a b : nat, p = a * g /\ q = b * g /\ is_gcd a b 1
is_gcd_plus : forall p q r : nat, is_gcd p q r -> is_gcd p (q + p) r
is_lcm_fun : forall p q r1 r2 : nat, is_lcm p q r1 -> is_lcm p q r2 -> r1 = r2
is_rel_prime_lcm : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> is_lcm p q (p * q)
is_gcd_minus : forall p q r : nat, p <= q -> is_gcd p q r -> is_gcd p (q - p) r
is_gcd_moduplus : forall p q k r : nat, p div k -> is_gcd p q r -> is_gcd p (q + k) r
is_lcm_sym : forall p q r : nat, is_lcm p q r -> is_lcm q p r
bezout_rel_prime : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q}}
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
Nat.sqrt_iter_spec : forall k p q r : nat, q = p + p -> r <= q -> let s := Nat.sqrt_iter k p q r in s * s <= k + p * p + (q - r) < S s * S s
bezout_sc : forall p q a b m : nat, a * p + b * q = 1 + m -> p div m \/ q div m -> is_gcd p q 1
bezout_nc : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> exists a b : nat, a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q
is_gcd_modulus : forall p q k r : nat, p div k -> k <= q -> is_gcd p q r -> is_gcd p (q - k) r
is_gcd_fun : forall p q r1 r2 : nat, is_gcd p q r1 -> is_gcd p q r2 -> r1 = r2
is_rel_prime_div_r : forall p q k : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> p div k * q -> p div k
is_rel_prime_div : forall p q k : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> p div q * k -> p div k
is_gcd_0 : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 0 -> p = 0 /\ q = 0
is_gcd_div : forall p q : nat, p div q -> is_gcd p q p
is_gcd_sym : forall p q r : nat, is_gcd p q r -> is_gcd q p r
Init.Nat.pred = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => n | S u => u end : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.pred _%nat_scope
is_gcd_mult : forall p q r n : nat, is_gcd p (n * p + q) r < -> is_gcd p q r
mult_is_one : forall p q : nat, p * q = 1 -> p = 1 /\ q = 1
Nat.Bezout = fun n m p : nat => exists a b : nat, a * n = p + b * m : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.Bezout (_ _ _)%nat_scope
Nat.divide_mul_split : forall n m p : nat, n <> 0 -> Nat.divide n (m * p) -> exists q r : nat, n = q * r /\ Nat.divide q m /\ Nat.divide r p
Nat.testbit_unique : forall (a n : nat) (a0 : bool) (l h : nat), l < 2 ^ n -> a = l + (Nat.b2n a0 + 2 * h) * 2 ^ n -> Nat.testbit a n = a0
